conclusion: Block a is initially at rest at point A.
Block b is initially at a height h.
The string remains taut.
The blocks are frictionless.
The blocks are connected by a thin pipe DE.
Block a collides with block b.
The collision is elastic.
The blocks come to rest without bouncing.
The total kinetic energy of the system before the collision is equal to the total kinetic energy of the system after the collision.
The kinetic energy of block a before the collision is KE_a = 1/2 mv_a^2.
The kinetic energy of block b before the collision is KE_b = 1/2 mv_b^2.
The kinetic energy of block a after the collision is KE_a' = 1/2 mv_a'^2.
The kinetic energy of block b after the collision is KE_b' = 1/2 mv_b'^2.
The total kinetic energy of the system after the collision is KE_total = KE_a + KE_b = KE_a' + KE_b'.
The potential energy of block a before the collision is PE_a = mgh.
The potential energy of block b before the collision is PE_b = mgh.
The potential energy of block a after the collision is PE_a' = mgh'.
The potential energy of block b after the collision is PE_b' = mgh'.
The total potential energy of the system after the collision is PE_total = PE_a + PE_b = PE_a' + PE_b'.
The kinetic energy of block a after the collision is KE_a' = 1/2 mv_a'^2.
The kinetic energy of block b after the collision is KE_b' = 1/2 mv_b'^2.
The total kinetic energy of the system after the collision is KE_total = KE_a' + KE_b' = KE_a + KE_b.
Equating kinetic energies: KE_total = KE_a + KE_b = KE_a' + KE_b'.
